isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL TANDEM AXLE FORWARD REAR DRIVE UNITS - CLEAN AND INSPECT - INSPECTING PARTS

svcproc.title: INSPECTING PARTS
svcproc.para: It is important to carefully inspect all parts before the carrier is assembled. Check all parts for wear and damage. Replace as required. Replacement of damaged or worn parts now will prevent failure of the assembly later.

step1.para: Inspect the cup, cone, rollers and cage of all tapered roller bearings. If any of the following conditions exist, the bearing MUST be replaced.

step2.para: The center of the large diameter end of the rollers is worn level with or below the outer surface ( Figure 57).

figure.caption: Figure 57. Center of Large Diameter End of Rollers Worn Level

step2.para: The radius at the large diameter end of the rollers is worn to a sharp edge ( Figure 57).
A visible roller groove is worn in the inner race surfaces of the cup or cone ( Figure 58).

figure.caption: Figure 58. Visible Roller Groove Worn in Inner Race Surfaces

step2.para: Deep cracks or breaks in the surfaces of the cup, cone inner race or roller cage ( Figure 59).
Bright wear marks on the outer surface of the roller cage ( Figure 59).

figure.caption: Figure 59. Deep Cracks or Breaks, or Bright Wear Marks

step2.para: Etching or pitting on rollers and on the surfaces of the cup and cone inner race that touch the rollers ( Figure 60).

figure.caption: Figure 60. Etching or Pitting on Rollers and Surfaces

step2.para: Spalling or flaking on the cup and cone inner race surfaces that touch the rollers ( Figure 61).

figure.caption: Figure 61. Spalling or Flaking on Cup and Surfaces

step2.para: Blue or brownish-blue discoloration on bearing cups, cones and rollers.

step1.para: Inspect the drive pinion and the ring gear for wear or damage. Gear sets that are worn or damaged MUST be replaced.

caution.para: Drive pinions and ring gears are machined in matched sets. When a drive pinion or ring gear of a hypoid set needs to be replaced, both the ring gear and the drive pinion must be replaced at the same time.

step1.para: Inspect the main differential and the inter-axle differential assemblies for wear or damage.
Parts that are worn or damaged MUST be replaced ( Figure 62).

figure.caption: Figure 62. Differential Gear Nest Assembly\ Differential Case Half

step2.para: Inside surfaces of both case halves.
Both surfaces of all thrust washers.
The four leg journals of the spider (cross).
Teeth and splines of both differential side gears.
Teeth and bore of all differential pinions.

caution.para: Always replace thrust washers, differential side gears and pinion gears in sets. A higher stress on parts and early failure of the assembly can occur if a new part is used with a worn part.

step1.para: Inspect the helical drive and the driven gears for wear or damage. Replace gears that are worn or damaged.
Inspect axle shafts for wear, stress or cracks at the flange, shaft and splines. Replace axle shaft if required.
